intro: Forsteronia luschnathii, commonly known as the Luschnath's evergreen hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early fall.
